## Description {#details}

A GCStrategy which serves as an example for the usage of a statepoint based lowering strategy.

This GCStrategy is intended to suitable as a default implementation usable with any collector which can consume the standard stackmap format generated by statepoints, uses the default addrespace to distinguish between gc managed and non-gc managed pointers, and has reasonable relocation semantics.

Definition at line 65 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp">BuiltinGCs.cpp</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### isGCManagedPointer() {#a32fa2acd693359684d5659d41ef2f02e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; bool &gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;BuiltinGCs.cpp&#125;::StatepointGC::isGCManagedPointer (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
If the type specified can be reliably distinguished, returns true for pointers to GC managed locations and false for pointers to non-GC managed locations.

Note a GCStrategy can always return &#39;std::nullopt&#39; (i.e. an empty optional indicating it can&#39;t reliably distinguish.
